articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Monday visited the Cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					Amid the playing of the wreath-laying music, a wreath in the name of Kim Jong Un and a wreath in the name of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea were laid before the cemetery. 
					
					Kim Jong Un together with senior officials of the party, state and army paid silent tribute to fallen fighters of the CPV. 
					
					Wreaths in the name of Kim Jong Un and the Central Military Commission of the WPK were laid before the grave of Mao Anying, son of Mao Zedong, the great leader of the Chinese people. 
					
					Kim Jong Un together with senior officials of the party, state and army paid silent tribute to Mao Anying. 
					
					He went round the grave of Mao and the cemetery. 
					
					He said that he visited the cemetery as he remembered the fallen fighters of the CPV who helped at the cost of blood the Korean people in their just cause of defending the country, greeting the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					Recollecting the feats performed by the brave soldiers of the CPV, he said mountains and fields of Korea are associated with their blood and noble souls. 
					
					The noble self-sacrificing spirit of the fallen fighters of the CPV who devoted their precious lives on the Korean front will always be remembered by the service personnel and people of the DPRK, he said, adding:
					
					The cemetery of fallen fighters of the CPV bears witness to the history showing the militant friendship between the peoples of the DPRK and China as they fought together for the common cause and it is a symbol of the DPRK-China friendship. 
					
					Recollecting with deep emotion October 26, 2010, when he visited the cemetery accompanying leader Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un said that it is the common responsibility, strong sense of moral obligation and mission of the two parties and two peoples of the DPRK and China to convey the revolutionary spirit and undying feats of the martyrs of the CPV down through generations, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Underscoring the need to preserve and manage well the cemetery in Hoechang County, spruce up all the cemeteries of fallen fighters of the CPV across the country and strengthen education through them, he took practical measures for doing so. 
					
					The Korean people should always remember the disinterested internationalist assistance sent by the Chinese party, government and people at a time when the Korean people were undergoing a trial and the blood shed by the fighters of the CPV and firmly carry forward the baton of the DPRK-China friendship, he stressed.
					
					He was accompanied by Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyok Sik, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yang Gon, Choe Pu Il, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho and Kim Kye Gwan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songhung Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Songhung Revolutionary Site
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, on Monday visited the Songhung Revolutionary Site where the Command of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) was located on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the  victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					He learned in detail about the display and preservation of the historical data and relics, looking round a half underground house, a tunnel, bed room, soldiers' hall, etc.
					
					At the half underground house he watched a photo President Kim Il Sung had taken with Peng Dehuai, commander of the CPV, looking back with deep emotion on the unforgettable days the armies and people of the DPRK and People's Republic of China fought shoulder to shoulder. 
					
					He dropped in at the operation room in the tunnel where a photo of the President autographing in high praise of the feats performed by the men and officers of the CPV on March 4, 1953 and his autograph were on display.
					
					There he noted that the Chinese party and government dispatched the CPV to help at the cost of blood the DPRK in its just struggle under the banner of "Resisting America and Aiding Korea, Safeguarding the Home and Defending the Motherland" when its people fought hard battles to beat back the imperialist aggression forces.
					
					Looking at the operation map hanging on a wall of the tunnel, he said many known and unknown fighters of the CPV including Hero Huang Jieguang produced during the battle on the Sanggam Pass unhesitatingly dedicated their youth and lives on the Korean front. 
					
					He went round the bed room used by the President several times including August 26, 1953 and visited by leader Kim Jong Il on August 25, 1954, Kim Jong Un said it is a precious historical relic which bears the mark of the wartime.
					
					He looked round the monument erected to convey the undying exploits of the President down through generations.
					
					Going round of the soldiers' hall where the President made a historic speech on August 27, 1953, Kim Jong Un said the army and people of two countries firmly consolidated the militant friendship, sharing blood in the struggle for their common cause. 
					
					At the end of his visit he gave instructions on preserving and managing the revolutionary site.
					
					He had a photo taken with the employees of the revolutionary site.
					
					He was accompanied by Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyok Sik, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yang Gon, Choe Pu Il, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho and Kim Kye Gwan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to War Veteran Delegates
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to War Veteran Delegates
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un sent gifts to the war veteran delegates taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					A meeting for conveying the gifts took place at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre on Monday.
					
					Present there were war veteran delegates.
					
					A speech was made by Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, for the occasion.
					
					The speaker said that the Marshal sent gifts of love to be conveyed long generation after generation to the war veteran delegates to the celebrations of the anniversary of the war victory. He said the delegates attended the celebrations and keenly felt how profound and warm the love and trust of the Marshal are as he is valuing and putting forward the war veterans.
					
					The Marshal took warm care of the delegates so that they did not feel inconvenience in their lives during the events and sent even gifts to them, the speaker said, adding boundless is the loving care of the Marshal.
					
					He called on the war veteran delegates to enjoy a worthy life in following Kim Jong Un just as they faithfully upheld the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, and keep their lives worthwhile in building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-reunification Patriot
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-reunification Patriot
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un Monday sent a birthday spread to Kim Yong Gyu, an indomitable pro-reunification patriot, on his 90th birthday.
					Kim Yong Gyu was subject to all sorts of national contempt and maltreatment over the grief of statelessness. He could enjoy a worthy life under the care of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					He was arrested by the enemies while bravely struggling against them during the Fatherland Liberation War. He had remained true to his revolutionary faith and the sense of moral obligation behind bars for decades.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il put forward him as indomitable pro-reunification patriot, DPRK hero and National Reunification Prize winner and sent a birthday spread to him on his 80th birthday.
					
					Kim Jong Un invited him to attend as a delegate the celebrations of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung and the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK, CPC Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK, CPC Held
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC) were held here on Monday.
					Present at the talks from the WPK side were Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, and officials of the C.C., WPK and from the CPC side a member of the delegation of the CPC headed by Jose Ramon Balaguer, head of the International Department of the Central Committee of the CPC, and German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					At the talks both sides informed each other of activities of their parties and exchanged views on boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and the two countries.
					
					The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Chairman of DPRK SPA Meets Italian Delegation
articles.content:
Chairman of DPRK SPA Meets Italian Delegation
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a delegation of the Italian Parliament led by Paolo Romani, vice-president of the Senate Group from the Popular Liberty who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Guests
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Guests
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, respectively met and had friendly conversations with the Zambian delegation led by Vice-President Guy Scott and Marcia de Campos Pereira, president of the Women's International Democratic Federation, who paid courtesy calls on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Greetings to King of Morocco
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Morocco
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Mohamed VI, king of Morocco, on the occasion of its national day.
					Kim in the message expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Morocco would grow stronger day by day and sincerely wished the king and his people success in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Overseas Koreans
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had conversations with the heads and leading members of the delegations of overseas Koreans taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Jang Jong Nam Meets Chinese Delegations
articles.content:
Jang Jong Nam Meets Chinese Delegations
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Monday met and had conversations with the delegation of war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) headed by Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and the delegation of war veterans and families of martyrs of the CPV headed by Yang Guoying, vice department director of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of China.

articles.title: Future of Korean People is Rosy: Nigerian President
articles.content:
Future of Korean People is Rosy: Nigerian President
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Nigerian President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan received credentials from DPRK Ambassador to Nigeria Jong Yong Chol on July 25. 
					At the meeting he recollected that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il gave material and moral support to Nigeria in the building of a new society. 
					
					Supreme leader Kim Jong Un is a great man with matchless courage and guts, he said, and went on:
					
					The future of the Korean people under the leadership of Kim Jong Un is very rosy. 
					
					I extend warm congratulations to the Korean people on the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war. 
					
					I wish the Korean people bigger successes in the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					It is my hope that the reunification of Korea will be achieved by the Korean people themselves free from foreign interference. 
					
					It is the invariable stand of the government and people of Nigeria to boost the relations of friendship and cooperation with the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Delegations Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Chinese Delegations Visit Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Chinese delegations visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					They included the delegation of war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) headed by Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, the delegation of war veterans and families of martyrs of the CPV headed by Yang Guoying, vice department director of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of China, and the literary and art delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA) headed by Li Xiubao, deputy head of the Publicity Department of the General Political Department of the CPLA.
					
					The guests went round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the story about the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung and his family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					At the end of the visit a member of the literary and art delegation said: Mangyongdae is the holy land of the revolution.
					
					Kim Il Sung and his family in Mangyongdae dedicated all their lives to the revolution. Their feats will shine long.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Swiss-Korea Committee headed by Chairman Martin Lotscher, Vice-Chairman of the British Friendship Society with Korea Dermot Hudson and the delegation of the Korean Friendship Association led by Chairman Alejandro Cao de Benos visited the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF). They came here to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					Chief of the mission Jo Il Min and its staff members greeted the guests and had conversations with them.
					
					At the conversations they informed each other of activities of their organizations and exchanged views on the matters of mutual concern.
					
					The chief expressed thanks to different organizations for positively supporting the just cause of the south Korean people for national reunification against the hostile policy toward the DPRK by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group.
					
					He said major media of the south are giving wide publicity to the undying feats President Kim Il Sung performed by winning the victory in the war on the occasion of July 27, the day of war victory.
					
					He referred to the dynamic actions being staged by south Koreans in demand of the conclusion of a peace treaty against the U.S. military presence and moves for a war against the north.
					
					The guests expressed belief that the reunification of Korea would certainly come true as there is the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is giving a steady continuity to the Songun revolutionary cause of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who carved out and defended the destiny of the country and nation.
					
					They expressed their will to extend the unequivocal support and solidarity to the south Korean people in their struggle for the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Foreign Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the WHO South-East Asia Regional Technical Consultation on Telemedicine headed by Rajesh Bhatia, acting regional director for WHO South-East Asia, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Monday.
					They laid bouquets before the statues of the peerlessly great men in boundless reverence and paid tribute to them.
					
					The delegation arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Zambian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Zambian President
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from Michael Chilufya Sata, president of Zambia, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Guy Scott, vice-president of Zambia who is leading the Zambian delegation, on a visit to the DPRK, on Monday.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Guests
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Guests
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received gifts from the visiting foreign guests on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					They included the Shanghai law and investment delegation of China, delegation of the Italian Parliament, former Thai foreign minister, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, co-manager of the ISES Publishing House of Germany and his companion, president of the Women's International Democratic Federation, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan, delegate of the Ireland-Korea Friendship Association, mayor of Deleg City of Canar Province of Ecuador and a Swedish film company manufacturer.
					
					Kim Jong Un received a gift in the joint name of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association and a German company.
					
					He also received gifts from the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Association, Karach Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, Turkey-Korea Friendship Association, Malaysia-DPRK Friendship Association, Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, New Zealand-DPRK Society, Russian Maritime Territorial Association for Friendship with Korea, Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, France-Korea Friendship Association, Korean Friendship Association, delegation of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship and the delegation of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association.

articles.title: Joint Appeal of Religious Organizations in North and South of Korea Issued
articles.content:
Joint Appeal of Religious Organizations in North and South of Korea Issued
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- It is 108 years since the U.S. and Japanese imperialists concluded the "Katsura-Taft Treaty", which provided Japan with an occasion of violating the inviolable territory of Korea and the destiny of its nation. The Council for the Reunification of Tangun's Nation of the north side and the preparatory committee of the conference of independent history of the nation and the Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation of the south side issued a joint appeal on Monday on this occasion.
					The "Katsura-Taft Treaty" was an "agreement" concluded between the U.S. and Japan in top secrecy the keynote of which was to connive each other at the U.S. occupation of Philippines and Japan's occupation of the Korean Peninsula, the appeal said.
					
					This criminal "agreement" fully proves the historical fact that the U.S. and Japan will conspire with each other to totally violate the sovereignty of the Korean nation according to the imperialist logic based on the jungle law, it noted.
					
					Japan is becoming all the more undisguised in its moves to pursue a new imperialist line by claiming Tok Islets, part of the inherent territory of the Korean nation for thousands of years, far from sincerely repenting and apologizing for the hideous crimes committed by it against the Korean nation in the past, though 108 years have passed, it said, and went on:
					
					The Korean nation is a cultured nation which has a history spanning five thousand years and created great culture to be proud of in the world. This is recognized by the world community, to say nothing of the U.S. and Japan.
					
					The national organizations in the north and the south and abroad should seek the best way of defending and glorifying the dignity of the nation through national cooperation which helps the north and the south become one, with the pride of being descendants of the proud ancestors of Tangun which have inherited the great intention of the sacred ancestors of Tangun and in the spirit of patriotism and unity, his noble teachings.
					
					We should inherit the forerunners' noble spirit of anti-Japanese independence and anti-imperialism, and the north and the south and overseas Koreans should rise up as one to shatter the evermore undisguised outrages and moves of crafty Japan under the banner of unity.
					
					The Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation, the Council of Bereaved Families of Men of Merit for Independence, the Federation of Homogeneous Nation Movement Organizations and 73 odd national organizations and patriotic religious delegates will take the lead in the resolute and dynamic anti-Japanese struggle. They will strongly oppose any form of war on the Korean Peninsula and, to this end, wage a strenuous movement to defuse the danger of war on the peninsula and achieve peace on this land.
					
					Let us firmly support the basic spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and dynamically advance to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country by pooling efforts and wisdom in the spirit of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: DPRK Party, Government Delegation Leaves for Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK Party, Government Delegation Leaves for Equatorial Guinea
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A DPRK party and government delegation headed by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, left here Monday to visit Equatorial Guinea.

articles.title: Mongolian Tourist Group Leaves
articles.content:
Mongolian Tourist Group Leaves
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian tourist group led by Shijir Gombosuren, general director of a travel agency of Mongolia, left here for home on Monday through Pyongyang-Ulan Bator international air route.

articles.title: DPRK Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Back Home
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK footballers came back home on Monday after taking part in the 2013 East Asian Cup.

articles.title: Delegates of War Veterans Celebrate Their Birthdays
articles.content:
Delegates of War Veterans Celebrate Their Birthdays
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Birthday parties took place on Monday in lodging quarters of the war veteran delegates taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					Present there were officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and war veteran delegates marking their birthdays.
					
					Speakers at the parties said that Marshal Kim Jong Un invited the war veterans to attend the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war as delegates, bestowed upon them honor and happiness unimaginable even in a dream and made sure that birthday parties were arranged for them.
					
					This reflects the deep loving care and trust shown by Kim Jong Un for them with hope that the war veterans, precious treasures of the country and forerunners of the revolution, whom the Workers' Party of Korea values and respects so much, would keep the flowers of the revolution in bloom in good health in the future, too, they stressed.
					
					They noted that the war veterans should bear in mind the intention of Kim Jong Un and hand down the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and the spirit of defending the country to the generations to come as legacies.
					
					They called on the veterans to perform their mission and duty as the generation who won the victory in the war in remaining true to the WPK's Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The war veteran delegates received significant birthday spreads, expressing boundless thanks and reverence for Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 20 (Enlarged Edition) off Press
articles.content:
"Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 20 (Enlarged Edition) off Press
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 20 (enlarged edition) was brought out in the DPRK.
					The book contains 44 works such as letters and talks published by him from April, Juche 88 (1999) to May, Juche 90 (2001).
					
					"Let Us Further Enhance the Role of Information Officials of Party Primary Organizations as Required by Revolutionary Advance in the New Century" and other works indicate tasks and ways for effecting a revolutionary turn in the party work as required by the changed situation.
					
					Clarified in "Loyalty to One's Leader and Supreme Commander Is Basic Characteristics of the People's Army" and other works are the tasks and ways for strengthening the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK into a matchless army.
					
					"On Some Problems Arising in Updating Major Industrial Sectors and Improving the Country's Economy", "On Some Tasks Arising in Improving the Standard of People's Living" and other works specify the orientation and ways for bringing about a revolutionary turn in building the economy and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					The book also contains works clarifying the idea of accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche by dint of politics on music as well as the Songun politics and the tasks and ways for further developing the Juche-based literature and art as required by the Songun era.
					
					Also contained in the book are works giving perfect answers to the theoretical and practical issues arising in the revolution and construction including the issue of strengthening education in the revolutionary traditions and the need for the officials to remain intensely loyal to the idea and leadership of the party.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Moves to Suppress Pro-reunification Bodies
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Moves to Suppress Pro-reunification Bodies
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The south Koran authorities threatened on July 26 to take measures to delete guide to the internet website of the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification.
					The Examination Committee for Broadcasting and News Agency Services of south Korea took this decision, echoing the assertion of the police for deleting data base of the homepage of the headquarters and guides to the organ of the organization The Path of the Nation after labeling them "literature benefiting the enemy".
					
					The south Korean puppet regime took such action as deleting articles from the homepage of the headquarters after labeling them "benefiting the enemy" but it is the first time that it decided to kill even guides, calling them into question.
					
					It blustered it would take an action against the headquarters on charges of violation of the evil law if the decision is not implemented within 15 days.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Come Out for Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Come Out for Peace on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The People's Action for Peace against War and the progressive policy post-graduate course of the opposition Unified Progressive Party in south Korea held an international peace seminar for conclusion of a peace treaty on the Korean Peninsula in Seoul on July 26.
					Present there were representatives of pro-reunification organizations in south Korea and experts on the Korean Issue from different countries.
					
					A professor of Ottawa University in Canada said in a lecture given at the seminar that Korea is still technically at war because the U.S. has pursued war moves for more than half a century, threatening the DPRK with nuclear weapons.
					
					He denounced the U.S. for not only keeping south Korea under its military occupation but mulling its forces' permanent presence.
					
					In order to ensure peace on the peninsula the U.S. forces should be pulled out of south Korea to the last man and the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" should be disbanded and an end should be put to their alliance.
					
					After speeches were over, an international peace declaration for putting an end to the war on the Korean Peninsula and urging the conclusion of a peace treaty was read out at the seminar.
					
					The declaration said that it is the way of achieving peace on the peninsula to start negotiations for the conclusion of a peace treaty and normalize the DPRK-U.S. relations.
					
					It demanded the U.S. stop insisting on its bankrupt sanctions against the DPRK and policy of pressure, promptly come out for negotiations for the conclusion of a peace treaty and halt joint war maneuvers with south Korea.

articles.title: Korean Fine Art, Stamp Exhibitions Open in China
articles.content:
Korean Fine Art, Stamp Exhibitions Open in China
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A Korean Fine Art Exhibition was opened in Beijing under the co-sponsorship of the Mansudae Art Studio of the DPRK and the Beijing Ji Shengchang Culture Co. Ltd. on Saturday, the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					On display in the venue of the exhibition are art pieces portraying President Kim Il Sung who performed exploits by winning a victory in the war including oil painting "On the Road of Advance".
					
					There are also art pieces dealing with popular heroism and matchless self-sacrificing spirit of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK during the war and the efforts of the Korean people for building a thriving socialist nation, art pieces produced by Chinese painters during their visit to the DPRK, art pieces on the themes of resisting America and aiding Korea and DPRK-China friendship, etc. 
					
					The exhibition will remain open till August 30. 
					
					A Korean Stamp Exhibition opened on the same day in celebration of the war victory day. It will last till August 4. 
					
					Meanwhile, a Korean book, photo and fine art exhibition opened in Hangzhou City, Zhejiang Province of China, Saturday on the same occasion. 
					
					On display there are photos dealing with the exploits Kim Il Sung performed by winning a victory in the war and the Songun leadership exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Also displayed there are famous works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and art pieces associated with creative wisdom and talents of the Korean people. 
					
					The exhibition will last till August 7.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Awarded Title of Honorary Chairman of Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Awarded Title of Honorary Chairman of Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was awarded the title of honorary chairman of the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					The certificate of the title was handed over to an official concerned by Teguh Santosa, secretary general of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange who is heading the visiting delegation of the association.

articles.title: DPRK's War Victory Day Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's War Victory Day Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Serbia, Guinea, India, Nigeria, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Mongolia and Slovakia during the period from July 16 to 22 to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					On display in the venues of the events were photos showing the undying revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, books introducing the immortal exploits of the peerlessly great persons and photos showing successes achieved by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					The international secretary of the New Yugoslavia Communist Party of Serbia said that the danger of war persists in the Korean Peninsula though many years have passed since the Armistice Agreement was concluded. He urged the U.S. to dismantle the "UN Command" and withdraw its armed forces for aggression from south Korea. 
					
					The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Sciences of Guinea lauded Kim Il Sung for defeating the Japanese and U.S. imperialists in one generation and inflicting a heavy defeat upon the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world during the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War and demonstrating the sovereignty and dignity of the country before the whole world. 
					
					The chief of the Kim Jong Il Library who is managing director of the Nigeria-Korea Stereo Industrial Company said that the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War is the common holiday of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives. The DPRK history of certain victory which started and triumphed with arms will be given steady continuity under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, he added. 
					
					Participants in the film shows watched such Korean films as "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu", "Arms of Korea" and "U.S. Imperialists Are Provokers of Korean War", the first part of the documentary "The Fatherland Liberation War".

articles.title: DPRK's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries observed the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on July 18 carried an article entitled "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" which said that the international community remembers with deep emotion Kim Il Sung, who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. It introduced in detail the exploits he performed by liberating Korea and achieving a victory in the war. 
					
					The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on July 17 carried an article entitled "Day of victory of Korean people" which said:
					
					On July 27, 1953, the U.S. signed the Armistice Agreement as good as a document of surrender, the first of its kind in history. 
					
					Six decades have passed since then. 
					
					During this period the U.S. has persistently pursued the policy for dominating the whole of Korea, far from drawing a due lesson from its defeat in the Korean War, and turned the Korean Peninsula into the biggest hotspot in the world. 
					
					It is the steadfast will of the DPRK to wipe out all aggressors so that no one would survive to sign such document of surrender if the U.S. ignites a new war. 
					
					The DPRK does not make an empty talk. 
					
					The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on July 14 and 21 carried articles "Truce not observed: war or peace" and "Event which startled world 60 years ago" praising the great victory of the Korean people in the war.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website by Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website by Swiss Organization
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's famous work "On the Korean People's Struggle to Apply the Juche Idea" was posted by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on its website on July 18.
					The work, published on June 30, July 1 and 5, Juche 72 (1983), explains the idea that the popular masses are the masters of their own destinies and creators of history, the background against which the Juche idea was founded and formulated theoretically and clarifies important matters arising in making the whole world independent.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Official of Int'l Body
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Official of Int'l Body
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, made public a statement on July 23 to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					Praising the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by achieving the victory in the war, he went on:
					
					History always remembers July 27, 1953, the day of victory in the Korean War. 
					
					Kim Il Sung's exploits are remembered not only by the Korean people but world progressive mankind and they occupy shining pages in the world history of wars. 
					
					True to the last instructions of the President for Korea's reunification, leader Kim Jong Il protected the sovereignty and dignity of the country with his unique Songun politics and provided a landmark for Korea's reunification by making sure that the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration were adopted. 
					
					The Korean people are now struggling against the U.S. imperialists' aggression and interference, having Kim Jong Un at the top posts of the party, state and army. 
					
					The world progressives and the anti-imperialist independent forces extend firm support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people standing on the forefront of the struggle against imperialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The gist of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was carried by the July issue of the  Romanian newspaper Romania Muncitoare.
					The work, published on Jan. 3, Juche 81 (1992), says that the historical lesson drawn from socialist construction is to steadily strengthen the driving force of the revolution with confidence in socialism and correct guiding idea, abide by the socialist principle and boost comradely unity and cooperation based on independence. 
					
					It clarifies the idea that it is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for socialist construction to thoroughly implement the three revolutions, ideological, technical and cultural, while strengthening the people's power and steadily increasing its function and role and its validity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos a delegados de veteranos de guerra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a delegados de veteranos de guerra
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio presentes a los delegados de veteranos de guerra a las festividades del 60o aniversario del gran triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					Tuvo lugar el dia 29 en el Anfiteatro del Parque Juventud la ceremonia de entrega de regalos.
					
					Estuvieron presentes los delegados de veteranos de guerra.
					
					La palabra de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Choe Thae Bok, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					El orador se refirio a que el Mariscal envio los regalos a los delegados de veteranos de guerra a las festividades del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					
					Anadio que a traves de los presentes actos de festejo los delegados habrian experimentado que ardientes son el amor y la confianza del Mariscal quien aprecia y presenta tanto a los veteranos de guerra.
					
					Prosiguio que es infinito el amor del Mariscal quien atendio minuciosamente a los delegados para que no se sientan las incomodidades durante el periodo de festividades y mando hasta los presentes.
					
					Destaco que los delegados de veteranos de guerra deben glorificar su vida en el camino a seguir fielmente al Mariscal como han venido apoyando con fidelidad a los grandes Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de PTC y de PCC
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de PTC y de PCC
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 29 en esta capital en un ambiente amistoso las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Comunista de Cuba. 
					Participaron por la parte coreana el miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Yong Il y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC, y por la cubana, el miembro de la delegacion del PCC encabezada por el jefe del Departamento Internacional del CC del PCC, Jose Ramon Balaguer y el embajador en Corea German Hermin Ferras Alvarez. 
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes informaron de las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y los dos paises.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con huespedes extranjeros
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con huespedes extranjeros
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 29 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae, por separado, en un ambiente amistoso con la delegacion de la Republica de Zambia encabezada por el vicepresidente Guy Scott, y con la presidenta de la Federacion Democratica Internacional de Mujeres, Marcia de Campos Pereira, quienes le hicieron visitas de cortesia.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop se reune con jefes y miembros principales de delegaciones de compatriotas
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop se reune con jefes y miembros principales de delegaciones de compatriotas
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, departio este lunes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con los jefes y miembros principales de las delegaciones de compatriotas en ultramar quienes toman parte en los actos festivos del 60o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.

articles.title: Mitin conjunto de militares y civiles con veteranos
articles.content:
Mitin conjunto de militares y civiles con veteranos
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 28 ante la pintura mural de mosaicos con imagen del Presidente Kim Il Sung, genial comandante de acero, erguida en el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario Jonsung, el  mitin conjunto de militares y civiles con los veteranos de guerra para festejar el 60o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					Asistieron Kim Yong Nam, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, los funcionarios de los organismos de las fuerzas armadas, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios de los organismos y empresas de esta capital, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes junto con los veteranos. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra de felicitacion, el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, dijo que el triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria fue la victoria brillante y orgullosa lograda por el poderio de la ideologia, estrategias y tacticas del Presidente y por el indoblegable espiritu del ejercito y pueblo coreanos. 
					
					Destaco que todos los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los habitantes deben defender a riesgo de la vida al Mariscal Kim Jong Un en cualquier situacion severa y apoyar con fidelidad la guia del Songun del partido para hacerse triunfadores en la confrontacion antiyanqui y en la construccion de un Estado prospero. 
					
					El conferenciante del Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, Kim Ki U, pronuncio un discurso en representacion de los veteranos. 
					
					El orador exhorto a las nuevas generaciones a luchar con el espiritu de defensa de la patria de la decada de 1950, en pleno acato a la guia del Mariscal sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun, para lograr la victoria final y la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					El oficial del EPC, Sin Sung Il, el jefe de taller del Complejo de Acero Chollima, Kim Hak Min, la presidenta de la junta administrativa de la Granja Cooperativa de Chongsan del distrito de Kangso, Yun Chun Hwa y el estudiante de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Rim Il Gwang, pronunciaron discursos de juramento en representacion de los oficiales y soldados del EPC, los obreros, los trabajadores agricolas y los jovenes y estudiantes. 
					
					Ellos enfatizaron que las nuevas generaciones deben guardar en el corazon el espiritu de los combatientes heroes que dedicaron sus vidas por la unica patria y continuar la historia y tradiciones de victoria en guerra, logradas y consolidadas por los grandes Generalisimos, y alcanzar la victoria final en la confrontacion antiyanqui.
